content:
Thunderbird is an email client - a program you download onto your computer. It is not a server.

You create mail account - one for each email address. Thunderbird then accesses server and downloads email into the mail account, so you can have emails being downloaded from various servers and view them all in one place. Thunderbird has many other features too numerous to mention eg: Calendar. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-GB/features/

Thunderbird is free program to download, but it does rely on people making donations so the product can be maintained. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ https://www.thunderbird.net/en-GB/about/ https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird/install-migrate-and-update https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird/calendar https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird/privacy-and-security-settings https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0/whatsnew/
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
To get the 'Print Preview' to work the email must be opened and have focus, it's not possible to do this with more than one email.

Old versions used to open email in background to access data. Some not so savvy people thought 'Print Preview' offered a more secure method of reading emails without opening them, not realising how you could see contents without opening them. The emails were opened in the background.

Then Firefox altered printing and so did Thunderbird as a certain amount of code is shared. The old opening in background ceased and now email must be selected and opened and have focus.

This then opens the 'Print Preview' window allowing you to make any necessary alterations.

For multiple: IF you select top level email of a collapsed thread so it shows the X number of messages in Message Pane Then right click on highlighted item in list and select 'Print'....

It does not open the 'Print Preview' window, but it should open the 'Print' window where you can select the name of printer.

I just tested this on an email which has 3 emails in thread (collapsed) and got the Print dialogue window. I selected printer and clicked Print

Now I do not need to actually print them and printer is turned off, so I accessed the 'Printer ' documents to see queue and there's 3 emails with same subject and slightly different sizes which match the ones in Message List. So it would have printed all three if printer was turned on.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help you.


When switching to so many email programs, servers can keep copies they don't even need.

spat out copies can sometimes end up in an inbox. and if you can see settings that your copies don't need to keep on the server, check your settings for this in Thunderbird.

To further delete these other email_programs if you do not use them is clear.

Sometimes it is called a bug.


Greetings firefox volunteer.

content:
In the "see also" section I found my solution: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1420329 This solution explains how to migrate Thunderbird profile from snap to Flatpak.

1 Copy your profile info to the Flatpak data zone:

  • from /home/.Thunderbird/
  • to /home/.var/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/cache/thunderbird

2 launch Thunderbird with option -P

  • flatpak run org.mozilla.Thunderbird -P
  • create new profile and then select the newly created profile in the Flatpak

content:
sfhowes said
I wasn't aware that Google ever allowed child accounts to be accessed through desktop mail clients, but that seems to be the current policy. They might have allowed existing child accounts to retain access, as with your old profile, after the policy was introduced to not allow new child accounts. You can try the method here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1374493

Thank you very much! It worked all fine.

Best regards,

Rosivaldo.

content:
I wasn't aware that Google ever allowed child accounts to be accessed through desktop mail clients, but that seems to be the current policy. They might have allowed existing child accounts to retain access, as with your old profile, after the policy was introduced to not allow new child accounts.

re :The account in question appears in 'All Folders', but only with Inbox, not with other Folders and Sub-folders which I have created.

Uncheck the 'Unified' for now. Using 'All' only... Did you try to subscribe to see folders?

  • Right click on imap mail account name in Folder Pane and select 'Subscribe'
  • click on 'Refresh'
  • Select folders and subfolders and click on 'Subscribe'
  • click on 'OK'

Did this get all folders to reappear ?
